newsitem.title: UK: Inquiry starts into fatal ScotPower blast.
newsitem.headline: Inquiry starts into fatal ScotPower blast.

text.p: An investigation is underway into a blast at an electricity sub-station in Scotland on Tuesday night, in which two men were fatally injured, with another remaining in hospital.
David Dryden, aged 30 and Innes McKinnon, 28, died after the explosion at the Scottish Power unit at 1800 GMT on Tuesday, a company spokeswoman said.
Jason Reynolds, aged 29, is "comfortable and stable" in the burns unit at Glasgow's Royal Infirmary, she said.
All three men were working for Scottish Power at the site.
An inquiry into the cause of the explosion started this morning, the spokeswoman said.
Scottish Power is expected to make a statement on the explosion later on Wednesday.
